tool.name: Filter SPAdes output
tool.description: remove low coverage and short contigs/scaffolds
tool.command: module load galaxy-scripts; module load perlmodules; filter_spades_output.pl --coverage-cutoff $coverage_co --length-cutoff $length_co #if $keep_leftover --filtered-out $filtered_out #end if --tab $stats_in $fasta_in > $fasta_output

param.name: fasta_in
param.label: Sequences
param.help: Contigs or scaffolds. Make sure you input the corresponding stat file

param.name: length_co
param.label: Length cut-off
param.help: Contigs with length under that value are shown in red

param.name: coverage_co
param.label: Coverage cut-off
param.help: Contigs with length under that value are shown in red

tool.help:
**What it does**
Using the output of SPAdes (a fasta and a stats file, either from contigs or scaffolds), it filters the fasta files, discarding all sequences that are under a given length or under a given coverage.
Typically, this is used to discard short contigs, or contaminations. To display a coverage vs. length plot, use the "SPAdes stats" tool in the same package.
